text.p: Here are highlights of stories reported by Hungary's press, based on information by Nepszabadsag's Hungary Around the Clock service. For further details on how to subscribe to Hungary Around the Clock, please contact Monica Kovacs at (361) 351 7142 or fax your request to (361) 351 7141.
ALL PAPERS
- MPs from the Socialist and Free Democrat parties delivered the Tocsik commission's report to the press over opposition objections yesterday, after the commission voted to make the document public.
- Leading politicians from coalition and opposition parties expressed diverse views yesterday about when to hold a referendum on NATO membership.

- The cabinet is expected to discuss the development of the financial and capital market in 1996 and last year's activities of the State Banking Supervision and the State Securities and Stock Exchange Supervision today.
- A senior Christian Democrat MP said the Barankovics Group formed late last week will not form a new party as had been reported Wednesday.
- Foreign Minister Laszlo Kovacs said yesterday that the process of accession to NATO has already begun.

- The Romanian cabinet decided after a lengthy debate Wednesday to pass an urgent decree amending the education law to allow Hungarian students to sit examinations for subjects they studied in Hungarian in their mother tongue.
- The difference between exports and imports continued to shrink in the first five months of the year, according to new data released by the Ministry of Industry and Trade.
- MTM-SBS and Magyar RTL representatives yesterday signed a broadcasting contract with National Radio and Television Board (ORTT) president Mihaly T. Revesz.
- The recently established alternative telecom company MKMTel Kft. will shortly call a tender to find a strong strategic investor, Magyar Hirlap reports.
- The cabinet resolved last week to have the National Radio and Television Board (ORTT) take a 25 percent stake in the state broadcasting company Antenna Hungaria Rt.
- The State Privatization & Holding Co. (APV Rt.) decided yesterday to modify the Ft 17 billion package of shares in about 30 companies that will be swapped for Postabank's underperforming assets.
- The State Capital Markets Supervision (APTF) yesterday accepted the Health Insurance Authority's offer to limit its voting right in Postabank to 15 percent.

- The directors of the State Privatization & Holding Co. (APV Rt.) ruled yesterday to remove former APV managing director Attila Lascsik from the board of the horse-breeding company Mezohegyesi Allami Menesbirtok Rt.
- The July issue of the financial magazine Euromoney selected Concorde Securities Rt. as the best Hungarian brokerage.
- Authorities are on the highest-level flood alert along the upper reaches of the river Danube waiting for the climax of the flood, expected for Friday.
- Police yesterday found 4.4 tons of special paper used for printing money in Akaszto, 80 km south of the capital.
- Former finance minister Lajos Bokros was promoted from senior adviser to director at the Central Europe and Central Asia section of the World Bank, effective July 1.
NEPSZABADSAG
- Parliament will substantially reduce the salaries of six Socialist MPs next month for unjustified absences.
NAPI GAZDASAG
- Gas-operated power plants will probably be barred from the tender to be called by the national electricity works MVM Rt. in two weeks.
